qas.question: By what name was the war with Japan referred?
What did Japanese officials call the war?
What was the reason Japan gave for the war?

answers.text: achieving their independence from the Western powers

qas.question: What date was the new name of the war released?
What name did Japan call the war?
When did Japan adobt the name for the war?
What was Japan's publicised war goal?
What did Japan call the occupied group of Asian nations?
How was the name of the war chosen by Japan?

context: Japan used the name <a0_0><a4_0>Greater East Asia War<a4_0/><a0_0/> (大東亜戦争, Dai Tō-A Sensō?), as chosen <a8_0>by a cabinet decision<a8_0/> on <a5_0>10 December 1941<a5_0/>, to refer to both the war with the Western Allies and the ongoing war in China. This name was released to the public on <a3_0>12 December<a3_0/>, with an explanation that it involved Asian nations <a2_0>achieving their <a6_0>independence from the Western powers<a6_0/><a2_0/> through armed forces of the <a7_0>Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere<a7_0/>. Japanese officials integrated what they called the <a1_0>Japan–China Incident<a1_0/> (日支事変, Nisshi Jihen?) into the Greater East Asia War.
